intro: Diplodium hians, commonly known as the zigzagged grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow leaves. The plant is distinguished by its inflorescence, which consists of dense clusters of spikelets arranged in a zigzag pattern along the stem. Diplodium hians typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
